intro: Synadenium halipedicola, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique member of the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers that appear during the dry season. Its leaves are reduced to small, scale-like structures, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to drought conditions. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is notable for its ability to survive in extreme environments.
